intro: Hermannia biserrata, commonly known as the serrated hermannia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its upright stems and clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have serrated edges, giving it its common name. Hermannia biserrata is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forests or rocky areas.
